qas.question: Nanjing's railway is important, and is located in what region of China?
What line does Nanjing serve as a railway junction for?
What lines comprise the Beijing-Shanghai (Jinghu) line?

answers.text: the old Jinpu and Huning Railways

qas.question: What high-speed railway is Nanjing connected to that contains Shanghai?
What type of railway lines are now under construction?

context: Nanjing is an important railway hub in <a0_0>eastern China<a0_0/>. It serves as rail junction for the <a1_0>Beijing-Shanghai (Jinghu)<a1_0/> (which is itself composed of <a2_0>the old Jinpu and Huning Railways<a2_0/>), Nanjing–Tongling Railway (Ningtong), Nanjing–Qidong (Ningqi), and the Nanjing-Xian (Ningxi) which encompasses the Hefei–Nanjing Railway. Nanjing is connected to the national high-speed railway network by Beijing–Shanghai High-Speed Railway and <a3_0>Shanghai–Wuhan–Chengdu Passenger Dedicated Line<a3_0/>, with <a4_0>several more high-speed rail lines<a4_0/> under construction.
